documentation: AWS IoT Events monitors your equipment or device fleets for failures or changes in operation, and triggers actions when such events occur. You can use AWS IoT Events API commands to create, read, update, and delete inputs and detector models, and to list their versions.

DeleteDetectorModel.documentation: Deletes a detector model. Any active instances of the detector model are also deleted.
DeleteDetectorModel.name: DeleteDetectorModel

DescribeDetectorModel.documentation: Describes a detector model. If the version parameter is not specified, information about the latest version is returned.
DescribeDetectorModel.name: DescribeDetectorModel

DescribeLoggingOptions.documentation: Retrieves the current settings of the AWS IoT Events logging options.
DescribeLoggingOptions.name: DescribeLoggingOptions

ListDetectorModelVersions.documentation: Lists all the versions of a detector model. Only the metadata associated with each detector model version is returned.
ListDetectorModelVersions.name: ListDetectorModelVersions

ListDetectorModels.documentation: Lists the detector models you have created. Only the metadata associated with each detector model is returned.
ListDetectorModels.name: ListDetectorModels

ListTagsForResource.documentation: Lists the tags (metadata) you have assigned to the resource.
ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource

PutLoggingOptions.documentation:
Sets or updates the AWS IoT Events logging options.

If you update the value of any loggingOptions field, it takes up to one minute for the change to take effect. If you change the policy attached to the role you specified in the roleArn field (for example, to correct an invalid policy), it takes up to five minutes for that change to take effect.
PutLoggingOptions.name: PutLoggingOptions

TagResource.documentation: Adds to or modifies the tags of the given resource. Tags are metadata that can be used to manage a resource.
TagResource.name: TagResource

UntagResource.documentation: Removes the given tags (metadata) from the resource.
UntagResource.name: UntagResource

UpdateDetectorModel.documentation: Updates a detector model. Detectors (instances) spawned by the previous version are deleted and then re-created as new inputs arrive.
UpdateDetectorModel.name: UpdateDetectorModel

Action.documentation: An action to be performed when the condition is TRUE.

firehose.documentation: Sends information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action to an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

iotEvents.documentation: Sends an AWS IoT Events input, passing in information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action.

iotTopicPublish.documentation: Publishes an MQTT message with the given topic to the AWS IoT message broker.

lambda.documentation: Calls a Lambda function, passing in information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action.

setVariable.documentation: Sets a variable to a specified value.

sqs.documentation: Sends information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action to an Amazon SQS queue.

Attribute.documentation: The attributes from the JSON payload that are made available by the input. Inputs are derived from messages sent to the AWS IoT Events system using BatchPutMessage. Each such message contains a JSON payload. Those attributes (and their paired values) specified here are available for use in the condition expressions used by detectors.

jsonPath.documentation:
An expression that specifies an attribute-value pair in a JSON structure. Use this to specify an attribute from the JSON payload that is made available by the input. Inputs are derived from messages sent to AWS IoT Events (BatchPutMessage). Each such message contains a JSON payload. The attribute (and its paired value) specified here are available for use in the condition expressions used by detectors.

Syntax: <field-name>.<field-name>...

timerName.documentation: The name of the timer to clear.

detectorModelDefinition.documentation: Information that defines how the detectors operate.

detectorModelDescription.documentation: A brief description of the detector model.

evaluationMethod.documentation: Information about the order in which events are evaluated and how actions are executed.

key.documentation: The input attribute key used to identify a device or system to create a detector (an instance of the detector model) and then to route each input received to the appropriate detector (instance). This parameter uses a JSON-path expression in the message payload of each input to specify the attribute-value pair that is used to identify the device associated with the input.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role that grants permission to AWS IoT Events to perform its operations.

tags.documentation: Metadata that can be used to manage the detector model.

detectorModelConfiguration.documentation: Information about how the detector model is configured.

inputName.documentation: The name you want to give to the input.

tags.documentation: Metadata that can be used to manage the input.

inputConfiguration.documentation: Information about the configuration of the input.

detectorModelName.documentation: The name of the detector model to be deleted.

inputName.documentation: The name of the input to delete.

loggingOptions.documentation: The current settings of the AWS IoT Events logging options.

DetectorDebugOption.documentation: The detector model and the specific detectors (instances) for which the logging level is given.

keyValue.documentation: The value of the input attribute key used to create the detector (the instance of the detector model).

detectorModelConfiguration.documentation: Information about how the detector is configured.

detectorModelDefinition.documentation: Information that defines how a detector operates.

DetectorModelConfiguration.documentation: Information about how the detector model is configured.

creationTime.documentation: The time the detector model was created.

detectorModelDescription.documentation: A brief description of the detector model.

evaluationMethod.documentation: Information about the order in which events are evaluated and how actions are executed.

key.documentation: The input attribute key used to identify a device or system to create a detector (an instance of the detector model) and then to route each input received to the appropriate detector (instance). This parameter uses a JSON-path expression in the message payload of each input to specify the attribute-value pair that is used to identify the device associated with the input.

lastUpdateTime.documentation: The time the detector model was last updated.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role that grants permission to AWS IoT Events to perform its operations.

DetectorModelDefinition.documentation: Information that defines how a detector operates.

initialStateName.documentation: The state that is entered at the creation of each detector (instance).

states.documentation: Information about the states of the detector.

creationTime.documentation: The time the detector model was created.

detectorModelDescription.documentation: A brief description of the detector model.

creationTime.documentation: The time the detector model version was created.

detectorModelArn.documentation: The ARN of the detector model version.

detectorModelVersion.documentation: The ID of the detector model version.

evaluationMethod.documentation: Information about the order in which events are evaluated and how actions are executed.

lastUpdateTime.documentation: The last time the detector model version was updated.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role that grants the detector model permission to perform its tasks.

status.documentation: The status of the detector model version.

Event.documentation: Specifies the actions to be performed when the condition evaluates to TRUE.

condition.documentation: Optional. The Boolean expression that, when TRUE, causes the actions to be performed. If not present, the actions are performed (=TRUE). If the expression result is not a Boolean value, the actions are not performed (=FALSE).

FirehoseAction.documentation: Sends information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action to an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.

deliveryStreamName.documentation: The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream where the data is written.

separator.documentation: A character separator that is used to separate records written to the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream. Valid values are: '\n' (newline), '\t' (tab), '\r\n' (Windows newline), ',' (comma).

inputConfiguration.documentation: Information about the configuration of an input.

InputConfiguration.documentation: Information about the configuration of an input.

lastUpdateTime.documentation: The last time the input was updated.

attributes.documentation: The attributes from the JSON payload that are made available by the input. Inputs are derived from messages sent to the AWS IoT Events system using BatchPutMessage. Each such message contains a JSON payload, and those attributes (and their paired values) specified here are available for use in the condition expressions used by detectors that monitor this input.

lastUpdateTime.documentation: The last time the input was updated.

IotEventsAction.documentation: Sends an AWS IoT Events input, passing in information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action.

inputName.documentation: The name of the AWS IoT Events input where the data is sent.

IotTopicPublishAction.documentation: Information required to publish the MQTT message through the AWS IoT message broker.

mqttTopic.documentation: The MQTT topic of the message. You can use a string expression that includes variables ($variable.<variable-name>) and input values ($input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>) as the topic string.

LambdaAction.documentation: Calls a Lambda function, passing in information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action.

functionArn.documentation: The ARN of the Lambda function that is executed.

detectorModelName.documentation: The name of the detector model whose versions are returned.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return at one time.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.

detectorModelVersionSummaries.documentation: Summary information about the detector model versions.

nextToken.documentation: A token to retrieve the next set of results, or null if there are no additional results.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return at one time.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.
A token to retrieve the next set of results, or null if there are no additional results.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return at one time.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results.
A token to retrieve the next set of results, or null if there are no additional results.

tags.documentation: The list of tags assigned to the resource.

LoggingOptions.documentation: The values of the AWS IoT Events logging options.

detectorDebugOptions.documentation: Information that identifies those detector models and their detectors (instances) for which the logging level is given.

enabled.documentation: If TRUE, logging is enabled for AWS IoT Events.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role that grants permission to AWS IoT Events to perform logging.

OnEnterLifecycle.documentation: When entering this state, perform these actions if the condition is TRUE.

events.documentation: Specifies the actions that are performed when the state is entered and the condition is TRUE.

OnExitLifecycle.documentation: When exiting this state, perform these actions if the specified condition is TRUE.

events.documentation: Specifies the actions that are performed when the state is exited and the condition is TRUE.

OnInputLifecycle.documentation: Specifies the actions performed when the condition evaluates to TRUE.

events.documentation: Specifies the actions performed when the condition evaluates to TRUE.

transitionEvents.documentation: Specifies the actions performed, and the next state entered, when a condition evaluates to TRUE.

loggingOptions.documentation: The new values of the AWS IoT Events logging options.

ResetTimerAction.documentation: Information required to reset the timer. The timer is reset to the previously evaluated result of the duration.

timerName.documentation: The name of the timer to reset.

SNSTopicPublishAction.documentation: Information required to publish the Amazon SNS message.

targetArn.documentation: The ARN of the Amazon SNS target where the message is sent.

durationExpression.documentation: The duration of the timer, in seconds. You can use a string expression that includes numbers, variables ($variable.<variable-name>), and input values ($input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>) as the duration. The range of the duration is 1-31622400 seconds. To ensure accuracy, the minimum duration is 60 seconds. The evaluated result of the duration is rounded down to the nearest whole number.

seconds.deprecatedMessage: seconds is deprecated. You can use durationExpression for SetTimerAction. The value of seconds can be used as a string expression for durationExpression.
seconds.documentation: The number of seconds until the timer expires. The minimum value is 60 seconds to ensure accuracy.

SetVariableAction.documentation: Information about the variable and its new value.

SqsAction.documentation: Sends information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action to an Amazon SQS queue.

queueUrl.documentation: The URL of the SQS queue where the data is written.

useBase64.documentation: Set this to TRUE if you want the data to be base-64 encoded before it is written to the queue.

State.documentation: Information that defines a state of a detector.

onEnter.documentation: When entering this state, perform these actions if the condition is TRUE.

onExit.documentation: When exiting this state, perform these actions if the specified condition is TRUE.

onInput.documentation: When an input is received and the condition is TRUE, perform the specified actions.

Tag.documentation: Metadata that can be used to manage the resource.

tags.documentation: The new or modified tags for the resource.

ThrottlingException.documentation: The request could not be completed due to throttling.

TransitionEvent.documentation: Specifies the actions performed and the next state entered when a condition evaluates to TRUE.

condition.documentation: Required. A Boolean expression that when TRUE causes the actions to be performed and the nextState to be entered.

tagKeys.documentation: A list of the keys of the tags to be removed from the resource.

detectorModelDefinition.documentation: Information that defines how a detector operates.

detectorModelDescription.documentation: A brief description of the detector model.

detectorModelName.documentation: The name of the detector model that is updated.

evaluationMethod.documentation: Information about the order in which events are evaluated and how actions are executed.

roleArn.documentation: The ARN of the role that grants permission to AWS IoT Events to perform its operations.

detectorModelConfiguration.documentation: Information about how the detector model is configured.

inputName.documentation: The name of the input you want to update.

inputConfiguration.documentation: Information about the configuration of the input.
